title: (x) similar to Akzidenz Grotesk Condensed - H&FJ Knockout No. 90 {Eric Gordon, Yves}
content:
This had been IDed elsewhere as Akzidenz Grotesk. Unless part of the letters had been modified though (at once, the “E” and the “S”, as well as the “8”, evidently don’t match), I believe that’s hardly it?... Couldn’t get any closer than Europa Grotesk, myself, either, which also doesn’t quite match yet (roughly, still missing that shorter horizontal middle bar in the “E”, at least)...

Would greatly appreciate any further help to get to the right match, thank you! :-)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161040im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/rsmt_4798.JPG)

 [‹ Virgin script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161040/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36241 "Go to previous forum topic") [Newcastle and Stella Artois beer logos ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161040/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36224 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ssa43

comments.content: The ones on blue are probably either [Champion](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161040/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/champion/index.html) or [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161040/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/index.html). The italics might be ’fake italics.’

This is H&FJ Knockout Series G [No. 90: Ultimate Welterweight](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007161040/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/testdriver/ko90.html), not Champion. Good catch, Eric. :^)
What else can I say? Thank you! (Had been wandering around for those perfectly round “S” and “8”.) Impressive. Thank you again so much! :-)
